column4: there was a powercut last night and because my computer shut down unexpectedly i cannot login. after i enter my password the screen goes black and then asks for the password again. this happened before and was resolved by deleting some file. i had thought rm ~/.cache/sessions/* would do it but it didn't help. can anyone suggest something that might?
make a new user. see if it works for them. as a test
i don't know how to do that from the command line, and as i've said a file just needs to be deleted like last time
ive never seen a issue like that caused by a cache/session file.
so its possiuble you are going about it the wrong way
try selecting a differnt session at the login screen perhaps.
i am certain some file just needed to be deleted last time, i remember because in the end it was so simple
perhjaps its .dmrc
switching sessions often breaks ubuntu
.dmrc?
Hmm.. no it shouldent break ubuntu.
my bad, *my xubuntu
the light dm login screen. the little gear icon should let you select other login sessions.
it's very similar
where can i find this .dmrc file to delete?
right in the users home dir..
ty writing it down
sudo rmdir /.dmrc or rm /.dmrc/* ?
its a file.. and its not /* anything... it would be in your HOME directory.
sorry, i thought . before a file meant it was an invisible dir
its a hidden file....
i'm going to post on forums (while logged into windows), and then try deleting dmrc, thanks for the help
rm ~/.dmrc didn't help, thanks though
do you think this problem is specific to xubuntu/xfce and i should be asking in their support channels instead?
